summary: This document is the daily lieutenant's log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York for August 15, 2019, covering three shifts (Morning, Day, and Evening Watch). It details routine operations, inmate counts, movements, and status changes, including inmates on suicide watch and psychological observation. The log shows normal facility operations on the day Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide in the same facility.

events.title: Daily Correctional Center Operations
events.description: Routine daily operations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, including multiple inmate counts, status changes (suicide watch, psychological observation), inmate movements for court, hospital, and transfers, and system checks.

locations.name: Metropolitan Correctional Center
locations.context: Federal detention facility in New York, NY, where the log was recorded.

locations.name: Local Hospital (L-Hosp)
locations.context: Medical facility where inmate Ho was taken and returned from.

keyFacts: The log documents August 15, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, but the log itself shows only routine operations with no direct mention of Epstein.
Multiple inmates were on suicide watch (#86452-054, #85431-054, #86640-054) and psychological observation (#71230-054, Turner #78236-054, #79984-054) with inmate companions.
The facility's fire alarm and public address systems were reported as malfunctioning or inoperable during the Day and Evening Watch shifts.
Inmate movements included court appearances, hospital visits, bail bonds, and transfers between housing units, reflecting normal correctional activity.
The log ends with a total inmate count of 756 and 72 inmates in the Special Housing Unit (SHU), with no administrative detentions recorded during the Evening Watch.
